subject: New York City Marathon
Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: Paula Radcliffe will defend her New York City Marathon title on Nov. 2, the New York Road Runners announced. Five months after winning the 2007 edition, Radcliffe was sidelined with a stress fracture in her left leg. That left her with little time to train for the Olympics, where she finished 23rd. Radcliffe has never lost on the New York course. Last year, she ran shoulder to shoulder with Gete Wami of Ethiopia nearly the entire race before pulling away in the last half-mile. Radcliffe’s victory came 10 months after she gave birth to her first child.
